Description: Nine fragments of a slipped pottery neck-amphora decorated in the Fikellura style. Six fragments with crescents, two with figural motifs: shoulder, tongues. (a) bitch, ? scut of hare; (b) perhaps hind part of sphinx sitting. Belly: crescents.
Curator's comments: Four fragments with crescents not illustrated in CVA This pot was badly misfired. The outer parts are coffee-coloured and the inner core is pink, as if after oxidization there had been incomplete reduction. BSA xxxiv, 11-12 (F 1), 63. Possible attribution to Wurzburg Group.
Bibliographic references: CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (Pl. GB 577, 1)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 63 § 60, pl. xxvii, 1)
Weber 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus anderen ägyptischen Fundorten (TD211)
